data.title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'openScopes' of undefined
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open a project in atom
2. Open a bunch of files
3. Switch branches

**Atom Version**: 0.209.0
**System**: Mac OS X 10.10.2
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'openScopes' of undefined


data.title: autosave@0.21.0
data.body: This ensures that files that have been moved or deleted aren't autosaved.

data.title: Search and Replace stops too early
data.body:
I have some strange issues with the search and replace tool:

Let's assume I have this text file:

```
1. thisModule.rowEditor
2. thisModule.rowEditor
3. thisModule.rowEditor
4. thisModule.rowEditor
5. thisModule.rowEditor
6. thisModule.rowEditor
7. thisModule.rowEditor
8. thisModule.rowEditor
9. thisModule.rowEditor
10. thisModule.rowEditor
```

I want to use search and replace to change "thisModule.rowEditor" to "thisEditor" in the rows numbered 6 to 10.

... so: 
- Search for "thisModule.rowEditor"
- Replace with "thisEditor"
- Position cursor in row 6
- Atom tells me "10 results found"
- Press "Find" - Atom selects the item in row 6
- Press "Replace" - Atom replaces the item in row 6 and selects the item in row 7.
- Atom tells me "9 results found"
- Press "Replace" - Atom replaces the item in row 7 and selects the item in row 8.
- Atom tells me "8 results found"
- Press "Replace" - Atom replaces the item in row 8 and **selects the item in row 1**.
- Atom tells me "7 results found"

I have absolutely no clue why it doesn't continue with row 9.

I can then click "Find" repeatedly to go on to row 9, press "Replace" - and again, it goes back to row 1 (not row 10).

Not sure if it is relevant, but I click the "Find" and "Replace" buttons with my mouse.

For me the problem occurs under Windows 8 x64, but I don't think that's relevant.

data.title: Syntax Error in Theme crashes Atom
data.body:
Atom 0.209.0

I have been writing a custom syntax theme. Leaving out a semicolon by accident caused Atom to crash during restart (cmd-alt-option-L), instead of switching to a default theme. 

```
COLOR.LESS
@string:#00894D// #30884D;  <-- colon missing
```

data.title: New default editor font
data.body:
This PR replaces the current default font for the editor. Fixes #7220

**Before**: The default is `Inconsolata`, but only if it's installed. If not, the fallback font is `Monaco`. The problem is that Inconsolata is quite smaller than other fonts, making it look bigger when changing the font in the settings. Or it's already too big when Inconsolata isn't installed. It's also a problem in mini editors.

**After**: New default is `Menlo`.
- Much closer to other fonts.
- Already comes preinstalled with OS X from Snow Leopard or newer.
- Is also the default in other editors/applications, like Xcode.

![default-font](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/8155190/b9f42d94-137c-11e5-8bf0-714972431662.gif)

Text in mini editors in some/most themes will look bigger. But they already do that, if Inconsolata isn't installed or if a user changes the font in the settings. So with this change, themes hopefully make the `@input-font-size` a bit smaller and then it would be more consistent with other fonts.

![screen shot 2015-06-15 at 4 16 11 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/378023/8155386/b3b808ae-137e-11e5-8327-51b88e79c72c.png)
### Possible alternatives
1. `Monaco`. It's the current fallback font if Inconsolata is not installed.
   - Pro: Less people would be affected by this change.
   - Con: Monaco doesn't have _italic_ and _bold_ version, which some themes use. Also in MD files. Menlo is newer and arguably more legible.
2. Bundle a new default font (see: #4201).
   - Pro: Could be any font, not just a system font. Would be consistent across all platforms.
   - Con: Even more users would be affected (also Win+Linux). Staying close to the platform might be a good idea because people are already used to that font from other editors/applications. Like Xcode uses Menlo and Visual Studio uses Consolas, in Atom it would be the same.
### Who is affected?
- Users that haven't changed the Font Family in the settings and have Inconsolata installed or are on OS X.
- Users that haven't changed the Font Size in the settings.
- Users that haven't changed the Line Height in the settings.
### I prefer the old default

For users that prefer the old default, it can be changed back in the settings to:
- Font Family: `Inconsolata, Monaco, Consolas, 'DejaVu Sans Mono', monospace`
- Font Size: `16`
- Line Height: `1.3`

data.title: Workspace.open() support for splitting up/down
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7059
Related to https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/99

Add ability to call `atom.workspace.open()` with `up` / `down` split properties.

data.title: Crash: Copy-Paste and Save As Javascript File
data.body:
(0. Generate Syntax Theme)
1. Copy Javascript from Sublime 3.
2. Paste Javascript into Atom.
3. Save as example.js

Atom freezes at step 3 and CPU is at 100%.
Issue is independent of selected theme.
Sometimes it works as expected, sometimes not.

Atom 0.209.0
Yosemite 10.10.3

data.title: Package list shows a `.bin` package.
data.body:
**Atom 0.209.0 on OS X Yosemite and El Capitan Beta**
As the title indicates, the Packages list in Atom Settings always show a package named ".bin". No Atom feature is negatively affected by this bug.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8125011/8151361/a2dc64c6-12d9-11e5-9feb-363a2e9a00c0.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8125011/8151333/cbeaaebe-12d8-11e5-9bec-8e9d5f05fa0b.png)
#### `atbuild` file content

``` javascript
#! /usr/bin/env node
require('./atbuild.js');
```

If you need any information that I can provide, please let me know.

data.title: Atom crashes if CIFS drive is remounted on Mac OS
data.body: Atom crashes if the underlying CIFS drive is unmounted and then remounted. This happens often if I lose a network connection.

data.title: Frequent recurring freezing on Windows
data.body:
I am getting random freezes and crashes on Windows 7. I am using Atom version 0.209.0.

Freezing occurs randomly (i.e. not all the time) when:
- changing values in the settings window.
- opening files (infrequent, big files seem to cause crashes more often).
- installing packages
- uninstalling packages
- closing tabs

I can't find any log files to get more information. The program is completely unresponsive and devtools console is not updated.

data.title: Filename highlighting is causing scrambled text
data.body:
I'm working on figuring out how to reproduce this consistently, but thought I would go ahead and get the issue started. All of the scrambled filenames are `.less` and `.css` files, which makes me think it has something to do with the `atom-compile-less` package, which compiles `.less` files into `.css` files automatically upon save.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2852617/8149540/44c793c8-127b-11e5-87b4-02be53ff02aa.png)

data.title: Better indicate preview tab
data.body:
It would be clearer to indicate preview tab by adding some visual effects.
This allows user to easily distinguish from normal tabs.
e.g. A different background color, text color or adding a special symbol.

data.title: Blank screen when launching Atom in development mode

When I launch Atom in development mode from the command line using `atom -d .` it displays a completely blank screen right after it loads. 

I only started seeing this issue when the developer tools were opening as Atom was opening. So, I have a hunch that this might be the issue. I tried closing the developer tools, then relaunching Atom, but that did not fix the issue.

data.title: Thin or small fonts rendered on Windows appear colorfully blurry.
data.body:
![Image of blurry/colorful font rendering](http://i.imgur.com/Crkn7gz.png)

Until looking through the code, I had thought Atom was using Microsoft's WPF graphics rendering interface for the GUI. In which case the solution is simply setting the text-formatting option to "Display" rather than the default "Ideal".

www.hanselman.com/blog/WPFAndTextBlurrinessNowWithCompleteClarity.aspx

I don't know what's causing blurry fonts on Atom, but it's certainly not my system configuration to blame; I'm not using any unusual settings/hardware; default DPI with a 1440x900 display. Other software (Notepad++, Visual Studio, Eclipse, etc) render fonts just fine.

data.title: Code sometimes improperly marked as comment
data.body:
Sometimes, when copy/pasting some code around with comments, I notice that part of my code becomes improperly marked as comments. You can see it happened here, and it becomes normal again when you play around with the comment above it:

![ex](https://www.dropbox.com/s/74wmso8114588gg/commented%20code.gif?dl=1)

Unfortunately, I have not yet found out how it can consistently be reproduced, but I've seen it happen at least 5-6 times already. 

I suspect though that it has to do with comment blocks starting with /*. As you can see in the screen recording, the marking seems to end at the */ in the path definition, so it looks as if it's thinking the code above it is part of a comment block still.

This is on Max OS X, Atom 0.209.
